name: 陳昶瑞
objective: This course will introduce students to using BIM for architectural design exploration, communication, and construction. The class will introduce essential software concepts and hands-on operations with Revit Architecture 2014. Hands-on exercises will lead students through the software interface, standard construction systems, creating parametric families and preparing construction documents.
schedule:
Week 01: Introduction to BIM and Autodesk Revit Architecture
Week 02: Basic Drawing, Editing Tools, and Datum Elements
Week 03: Creating a Model and Views
Week 04: Dimensioning and Annotating
Week 05: Floors
Week 06: Roofs
Week 07: Structural Items
Week 08: Ceilings and Interiors
Week 09: Stairs, Ramps, and Railings
Week 10: Adding Families
Week 11: Modifying Families
Week 12: Schematic Design
Week 13: Rooms and Color-Fill Plans
Week 14: Materials, Rendering, and Visualization
Week 15: Worksharing
Week 16: No Class
Week 17: Details and Annotations
Week 18: Project Presentation
materials: Duell, R., Hathorn, T., and Hathorn, T. R., Autodesk Revit Architecture 2014 Essentials: Autodesk Official Press, Sybex, 1st Edition.
